data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you face to the right of the starting point and run back in the direction you headed on the map, then you would go back to the starting point instead of facing forward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can turn around and back. You can also just stay where you are and walk back. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Let’s say you have 6 steps to go. You then take 4 steps to go back 6 steps to go. Then turn around and take 5 more steps to go back 10 steps to go. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 7 steps then you can turn left. The answer: Yes.

Your total should increase when coming back the same way. The starting point should decrease when moving back the same way. So, the answer is no.

Turn around, turn left and turn around. Take 5 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

No one gets back to the starting point. You return. There are no ways to get back. You start again. So, the answer is no.

Twit around is the opposite of take 2 steps. And take 2 steps is inverse of take 6-1-2. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you will always take one step from the right. If you always take one step left, you will always take two steps from the right. If you always take 2 steps left, you will always take 3 steps from the left. If you always take 6 steps forward, you will always take 6 steps from the right. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can’t go backwards if you’re already doing the opposite. Taking 9 steps back gives you 2 remaining steps. 2 steps is the same thing as 2 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 1 step backward is a form of backwards step in a directional manner. Take 1 step backward is a form of backwards step in a directional order. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you are always facing forward, the first direction you would need to point is forward, and the second is facing backward, which is the opposite direction we would need to point. The first direction would be forward, and the second would be backwards if we wanted to point left. If you are always facing forward and you are directed to go left, and taking right turns, the first direction you would need to point is right and taking one turn is to the left. So, the answer is Yes.

Take in step from left to right until you reach the starting point. Keep your face facing forward always and always. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, you will take the same direction of step as when you started from it. If you always face left, you will take the same direction of step as when you started from it – Left. So, the answer is yes.

The person is facing forward. So taking 3 steps right means you are taking 3 steps right. The person is facing right and takes 3 steps for each side of the line. The person is facing left and takes 6 steps. So the person is facing left and takes 3 steps for each side of the line. The person is facing right and takes 3 steps left. So the person is facing the right and takes 3 steps for each side of the line. So he is facing the right and takes 3 steps for each side of the line. So the answer is No.
